property.name: tez.session.am.dag.submit.timeout.secs
property.description: Time (in seconds) for which the Tez AM should wait for a DAG to be submitted before shutting down

property.name: hive.server2.materializedviews.registry.impl
property.description: Expects one of [default, dummy]. The implementation that we should use for the materialized views registry. DEFAULT: Default cache for materialized views DUMMY: Do not cache materialized views and hence forward requests to metastore

property.name: hive.server2.max.start.attempts
property.description: This number of times HiveServer2 will attempt to start before exiting, sleeping 60 seconds between retries.

property.name: hive.server2.transport.mode
property.description: Expects one of [binary, http]. Transport mode of HiveServer2.

property.name: hive.default.fileformat
property.description: Default file format for CREATE TABLE statement.

entry.description: The Optimized Row Columnar (ORC) file format provides a highly efficient way to store Hive data. It was designed to overcome limitations of the other Hive file formats. Using ORC files improves performance when Hive is reading, writing, and processing data.
Text file format saves Hive data as normal text.

property.name: hive.metastore.sasl.enabled
property.description: If true, the metastore thrift interface will be secured with SASL. Clients must authenticate with Kerberos.

property.name: hive.metastore.execute.setugi
property.description: In unsecure mode, setting this property to true will cause the metastore to execute DFS operations using the client's reported user and group permissions. Note that this property must be set on both the client and server sides. Further note that its best effort. If client sets its to true and server sets it to false, client setting will be ignored.

property.name: hive.optimize.bucketmapjoin.sortedmerge
property.description: If the tables being joined are sorted and bucketized on the join columns, and they have the same number of buckets, a sort-merge join can be performed by setting this parameter as true.

property.name: hive.tez.container.size
property.description: By default, Tez uses the java options from map tasks. Use this property to override that value.

property.name: hive.tez.input.format
property.description: The default input format for Tez. Tez groups splits in the Application Master.

property.name: hive.tez.java.opts
property.description: Java command line options for Tez.

property.name: hive.txn.timeout
property.description: Time after which transactions are declared aborted if the client has not sent a heartbeat, in seconds.

property.name: hive.compactor.initiator.on
property.description: Whether to run the compactor's initiator thread in this metastore instance or not. If there is more than one instance of the thrift metastore this should be set to true on only one instance. Setting true on only one host can be achieved by creating a config-group containing the metastore host, and overriding the default value to true in it.

property.name: hive.compactor.worker.threads
property.description: Number of compactor worker threads to run on this metastore instance. Can be different values on different metastore instances.
property.display-name: Number of threads used by Compactor

property.name: hive.create.as.insert.only
property.description: Whether the eligible tables should be created as ACID insert-only by default. Does not apply to external tables, the ones using storage handlers, etc.
property.display-name: Create Tables as ACID Insert Only

property.name: metastore.create.as.acid
property.description: Whether the eligible tables should be created as full ACID by default. Does not apply to external tables, the ones using storage handlers, etc.

property.name: hive.compactor.delta.num.threshold
property.description: Number of delta files that must exist in a directory before the compactor will attempt a minor compaction.

property.name: hive.compactor.abortedtxn.threshold
property.description: Number of aborted transactions involving a particular table or partition before major compaction is initiated.

property.name: datanucleus.cache.level2.type
property.description: Determines caching mechanism DataNucleus L2 cache will use. It is strongly recommended to use default value of 'none' as other values may cause consistency errors in Hive.

property.name: hive.zookeeper.quorum
property.description: List of ZooKeeper servers to talk to. This is needed for: 1. Read/write locks - when hive.lock.manager is set to org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.lockmgr.zookeeper.ZooKeeperHiveLockManager, 2. When HiveServer2 supports service discovery via Zookeeper.

property.name: hive.metastore.connect.retries
property.description: Number of retries while opening a connection to metastore

property.name: hive.metastore.failure.retries
property.description: Number of retries upon failure of Thrift metastore calls

property.name: hive.metastore.client.connect.retry.delay
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. Number of seconds for the client to wait between consecutive connection attempts

property.name: hive.metastore.client.socket.timeout
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. MetaStore Client socket timeout in seconds

property.name: hive.cluster.delegation.token.store.class
property.description: The delegation token store implementation. Set to org.apache.hadoop.hive.thrift.ZooKeeperTokenStore for load-balanced cluster.

property.name: hive.cluster.delegation.token.store.zookeeper.connectString
property.description: The ZooKeeper token store connect string.

property.name: hive.server2.support.dynamic.service.discovery
property.description: Whether HiveServer2 supports dynamic service discovery for its clients. To support this, each instance of HiveServer2 currently uses ZooKeeper to register itself, when it is brought up. JDBC/ODBC clients should use the ZooKeeper ensemble: hive.zookeeper.quorum in their connection string.

property.name: hive.exec.scratchdir
property.description: HDFS root scratch dir for Hive jobs which gets created with write all (733) permission. For each connecting user, an HDFS scratch dir: ${hive.exec.scratchdir}/<username> is created, with ${hive.scratch.dir.permission}.

property.name: hive.exec.submit.local.task.via.child
property.description: Determines whether local tasks (typically mapjoin hashtable generation phase) runs in separate JVM (true recommended) or not. Avoids the overhead of spawning new JVM, but can lead to out-of-memory issues.

property.name: hive.exec.compress.output
property.description: This controls whether the final outputs of a query (to a local/HDFS file or a Hive table) is compressed. The compression codec and other options are determined from Hadoop config variables mapred.output.compress*

property.name: hive.exec.compress.intermediate
property.description: This controls whether intermediate files produced by Hive between multiple map-reduce jobs are compressed. The compression codec and other options are determined from Hadoop config variables mapred.output.compress*

property.name: hive.exec.reducers.bytes.per.reducer
property.description: Defines the size per reducer. For example, if it is set to 64M, given 256M input size, 4 reducers will be used.

property.name: hive.exec.reducers.max
property.description: max number of reducers will be used. If the one specified in the configuration parameter mapred.reduce.tasks is negative, Hive will use this one as the max number of reducers when automatically determine number of reducers.

property.name: hive.exec.pre.hooks
property.description: Comma-separated list of pre-execution hooks to be invoked for each statement. A pre-execution hook is specified as the name of a Java class which implements the org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.hooks.ExecuteWithHookContext interface.

property.name: hive.exec.post.hooks
property.description: Comma-separated list of post-execution hooks to be invoked for each statement. A post-execution hook is specified as the name of a Java class which implements the org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.hooks.ExecuteWithHookContext interface.

property.name: hive.exec.failure.hooks
property.description: Comma-separated list of on-failure hooks to be invoked for each statement. An on-failure hook is specified as the name of Java class which implements the org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.hooks.ExecuteWithHookContext interface.

property.name: hive.exec.parallel
property.description: Whether to execute jobs in parallel

property.name: hive.exec.parallel.thread.number
property.description: How many jobs at most can be executed in parallel

property.name: hive.mapred.reduce.tasks.speculative.execution
property.description: Whether speculative execution for reducers should be turned on.

property.name: hive.exec.dynamic.partition
property.description: Whether or not to allow dynamic partitions in DML/DDL.

property.name: hive.exec.dynamic.partition.mode
property.description: In strict mode, the user must specify at least one static partition in case the user accidentally overwrites all partitions. NonStrict allows all partitions of a table to be dynamic.
property.display-name: Allow all partitions to be Dynamic

property.name: hive.exec.max.dynamic.partitions
property.description: Maximum number of dynamic partitions allowed to be created in total.

property.name: hive.exec.max.dynamic.partitions.pernode
property.description: Maximum number of dynamic partitions allowed to be created in each mapper/reducer node.

property.name: hive.exec.max.created.files
property.description: Maximum number of HDFS files created by all mappers/reducers in a MapReduce job.

property.name: hive.metastore.warehouse.dir
property.description: location of default database for the warehouse

property.name: hive.metastore.warehouse.external.dir
property.description: location of default database for the warehouse of external tables

property.name: hive.metastore.uris
property.description: Thrift URI for the remote metastore. Used by metastore client to connect to remote metastore.

property.name: hive.metastore.db.type
property.description: Hive Metastore Database Type.

property.name: javax.jdo.option.ConnectionPassword
property.description: password to use against metastore database

property.name: javax.jdo.option.ConnectionURL
property.description: JDBC connect string for a JDBC metastore

property.name: hive.metastore.server.max.threads
property.description: Maximum number of worker threads in the Thrift server's pool.

property.name: hive.metastore.kerberos.keytab.file
property.description: The path to the Kerberos Keytab file containing the metastore Thrift server's service principal.

property.name: hive.metastore.kerberos.principal
property.description: The service principal for the metastore Thrift server. The special string _HOST will be replaced automatically with the correct host name.

property.name: hive.cluster.delegation.token.store.zookeeper.znode
property.description: The root path for token store data.

property.name: hive.metastore.cache.pinobjtypes
property.description: List of comma separated metastore object types that should be pinned in the cache

property.name: hive.metastore.pre.event.listeners
property.description: List of comma separated listeners for metastore events.

property.name: hive.metastore.authorization.storage.checks
property.description: Should the metastore do authorization checks against the underlying storage (usually hdfs) for operations like drop-partition (disallow the drop-partition if the user in question doesn't have permissions to delete the corresponding directory on the storage).

property.name: javax.jdo.option.ConnectionDriverName
property.description: Driver class name for a JDBC metastore

property.name: javax.jdo.option.ConnectionUserName
property.description: username to use against metastore database

property.name: hive.map.aggr
property.description: Whether to use map-side aggregation in Hive Group By queries

property.name: hive.cbo.enable
property.description: Flag to control enabling Cost Based Optimizations using Calcite framework.

property.name: hive.mapjoin.optimized.hashtable
property.description: Whether Hive should use memory-optimized hash table for MapJoin. Only works on Tez, because memory-optimized hashtable cannot be serialized.

property.name: hive.smbjoin.cache.rows
property.description: How many rows with the same key value should be cached in memory per smb joined table.

property.name: hive.map.aggr.hash.percentmemory
property.description: Portion of total memory to be used by map-side group aggregation hash table

property.name: hive.map.aggr.hash.force.flush.memory.threshold
property.description: The max memory to be used by map-side group aggregation hash table. If the memory usage is higher than this number, force to flush data

property.name: hive.map.aggr.hash.min.reduction
property.description: Hash aggregation will be turned off if the ratio between hash table size and input rows is bigger than this number. Set to 1 to make sure hash aggregation is never turned off.

property.name: hive.merge.mapfiles
property.description: Merge small files at the end of a map-only job

property.name: hive.merge.mapredfiles
property.description: Merge small files at the end of a map-reduce job

property.name: hive.merge.tezfiles
property.description: Merge small files at the end of a Tez DAG

property.name: hive.merge.size.per.task
property.description: Size of merged files at the end of the job

property.name: hive.merge.smallfiles.avgsize
property.description: When the average output file size of a job is less than this number, Hive will start an additional map-reduce job to merge the output files into bigger files. This is only done for map-only jobs if hive.merge.mapfiles is true, and for map-reduce jobs if hive.merge.mapredfiles is true.

property.name: hive.merge.orcfile.stripe.level
property.description: When hive.merge.mapfiles or hive.merge.mapredfiles is enabled while writing a table with ORC file format, enabling this config will do stripe level fast merge for small ORC files. Note that enabling this config will not honor padding tolerance config (hive.exec.orc.block.padding.tolerance).

property.name: hive.orc.splits.include.file.footer
property.description: If turned on splits generated by orc will include metadata about the stripes in the file. This data is read remotely (from the client or HS2 machine) and sent to all the tasks.

property.name: hive.orc.compute.splits.num.threads
property.description: How many threads orc should use to create splits in parallel.

property.name: hive.auto.convert.join
property.description: Whether Hive enables the optimization about converting common join into mapjoin based on the input file size

property.name: hive.auto.convert.join.noconditionaltask
property.description: Whether Hive enables the optimization about converting common join into mapjoin based on the input file size. If this parameter is on, and the sum of size for n-1 of the tables/partitions for a n-way join is smaller than the specified size, the join is directly converted to a mapjoin (there is no conditional task).

property.name: hive.limit.optimize.enable
property.description: Whether to enable to optimization to trying a smaller subset of data for simple LIMIT first.

property.name: hive.tez.cpu.vcores
property.description: By default Tez will ask for however many cpus map-reduce is configured to use per container. This can be used to overwrite.

property.name: hive.tez.log.level
property.description: The log level to use for tasks executing as part of the DAG. Used only if hive.tez.java.opts is used to configure Java options.

property.name: hive.enforce.sortmergebucketmapjoin
property.description: If the user asked for sort-merge bucketed map-side join, and it cannot be performed, should the query fail or not ?

property.name: hive.auto.convert.sortmerge.join
property.description: Will the join be automatically converted to a sort-merge join, if the joined tables pass the criteria for sort-merge join.

property.name: hive.auto.convert.sortmerge.join.to.mapjoin
property.description: If hive.auto.convert.sortmerge.join is set to true, and a join was converted to a sort-merge join, this parameter decides whether each table should be tried as a big table, and effectively a map-join should be tried. That would create a conditional task with n+1 children for a n-way join (1 child for each table as the big table), and the backup task will be the sort-merge join. In some cases, a map-join would be faster than a sort-merge join, if there is no advantage of having the output bucketed and sorted. For example, if a very big sorted and bucketed table with few files (say 10 files) are being joined with a very small sorter and bucketed table with few files (10 files), the sort-merge join will only use 10 mappers, and a simple map-only join might be faster if the complete small table can fit in memory, and a map-join can be performed.

property.name: hive.optimize.constant.propagation
property.description: Whether to enable constant propagation optimizer

property.name: hive.optimize.null.scan
property.description: Dont scan relations which are guaranteed to not generate any rows

property.name: hive.optimize.bucketmapjoin
property.description: Whether to try bucket mapjoin

property.name: hive.optimize.reducededuplication
property.description: Remove extra map-reduce jobs if the data is already clustered by the same key which needs to be used again. This should always be set to true. Since it is a new feature, it has been made configurable.

property.name: hive.optimize.reducededuplication.min.reducer
property.description: Reduce deduplication merges two RSs by moving key/parts/reducer-num of the child RS to parent RS. That means if reducer-num of the child RS is fixed (order by or forced bucketing) and small, it can make very slow, single MR. The optimization will be automatically disabled if number of reducers would be less than specified value.

property.name: hive.optimize.sort.dynamic.partition
property.description: When enabled dynamic partitioning column will be globally sorted. This way we can keep only one record writer open for each partition value in the reducer thereby reducing the memory pressure on reducers.

property.name: hive.stats.autogather
property.description: A flag to gather statistics automatically during the INSERT OVERWRITE command.

property.name: hive.stats.dbclass
property.description: Expects one of the pattern in [jdbc(:.*), hbase, counter, custom, fs]. The storage that stores temporary Hive statistics. Currently, jdbc, hbase, counter and custom type are supported.

property.name: hive.stats.fetch.partition.stats
property.description: Annotation of operator tree with statistics information requires partition level basic statistics like number of rows, data size and file size. Partition statistics are fetched from metastore. Fetching partition statistics for each needed partition can be expensive when the number of partitions is high. This flag can be used to disable fetching of partition statistics from metastore. When this flag is disabled, Hive will make calls to filesystem to get file sizes and will estimate the number of rows from row schema.

property.name: hive.stats.fetch.column.stats
property.description: Annotation of operator tree with statistics information requires column statistics. Column statistics are fetched from metastore. Fetching column statistics for each needed column can be expensive when the number of columns is high. This flag can be used to disable fetching of column statistics from metastore.

property.name: hive.zookeeper.client.port
property.description: The port of ZooKeeper servers to talk to. If the list of Zookeeper servers specified in hive.zookeeper.quorum,does not contain port numbers, this value is used.

property.name: hive.zookeeper.namespace
property.description: The parent node under which all ZooKeeper nodes are created.

property.name: hive.txn.max.open.batch
property.description: Maximum number of transactions that can be fetched in one call to open_txns(). Increasing this will decrease the number of delta files created when streaming data into Hive. But it will also increase the number of open transactions at any given time, possibly impacting read performance.

property.name: hive.support.concurrency
property.description: Support concurrency and use locks, needed for Transactions. Requires Zookeeper.

property.name: hive.cli.print.header
property.description: Whether to print the names of the columns in query output.

property.name: hive.compactor.worker.timeout
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. Time before a given compaction in working state is declared a failure and returned to the initiated state.

property.name: hive.compactor.check.interval
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. Time between checks to see if any partitions need compacted. This should be kept high because each check for compaction requires many calls against the NameNode.

property.name: hive.compactor.delta.pct.threshold
property.description: Percentage (by size) of base that deltas can be before major compaction is initiated.

property.name: hive.fetch.task.conversion
property.description: Expects one of [none, minimal, more]. Some select queries can be converted to single FETCH task minimizing latency. Currently the query should be single sourced not having any subquery and should not have any aggregations or distincts (which incurs RS), lateral views and joins. 0. none : disable hive.fetch.task.conversion 1. minimal : SELECT STAR, FILTER on partition columns, LIMIT only 2. more : SELECT, FILTER, LIMIT only (support TABLESAMPLE and virtual columns)

property.name: hive.fetch.task.conversion.threshold
property.description: Input threshold for applying hive.fetch.task.conversion. If target table is native, input length is calculated by summation of file lengths. If it's not native, storage handler for the table can optionally implement org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.metadata.InputEstimator interface.

property.name: hive.fetch.task.aggr
property.description: Aggregation queries with no group-by clause (for example, select count(*) from src) execute final aggregations in single reduce task. If this is set true, Hive delegates final aggregation stage to fetch task, possibly decreasing the query time.

property.name: hive.security.metastore.authorization.manager
property.description: authorization manager class name to be used in the metastore for authorization. The user defined authorization class should implement interface org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.security.authorization.HiveMetastoreAuthorizationProvider.

property.name: hive.security.metastore.authorization.auth.reads
property.description: If this is true, metastore authorizer authorizes read actions on database, table

property.name: hive.security.metastore.authenticator.manager
property.description: authenticator manager class name to be used in the metastore for authentication. The user defined authenticator should implement interface org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.security.HiveAuthenticationProvider.

property.name: hive.server2.logging.operation.enabled
property.description: When true, HS2 will save operation logs

property.name: hive.server2.logging.operation.log.location
property.description: Top level directory where operation logs are stored if logging functionality is enabled

property.name: hive.server2.zookeeper.namespace
property.description: The parent node in ZooKeeper used by HiveServer2 when supporting dynamic service discovery.

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.http.port
property.description: Port number of HiveServer2 Thrift interface when hive.server2.transport.mode is 'http'.

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.port
property.description: TCP port number to listen on, default 10000.

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.sasl.qop
property.description: Expects one of [auth, auth-int, auth-conf]. Sasl QOP value; Set it to one of following values to enable higher levels of protection for HiveServer2 communication with clients. "auth" - authentication only (default) "auth-int" - authentication plus integrity protection "auth-conf" - authentication plus integrity and confidentiality protection This is applicable only if HiveServer2 is configured to use Kerberos authentication.

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.max.worker.threads
property.description: Maximum number of Thrift worker threads

property.name: hive.server2.allow.user.substitution
property.description: Allow alternate user to be specified as part of HiveServer2 open connection request.

property.name: hive.server2.authentication.spnego.keytab
property.description: keytab file for SPNego principal, optional, typical value would look like /etc/security/keytabs/spnego.service.keytab, This keytab would be used by HiveServer2 when Kerberos security is enabled and HTTP transport mode is used. This needs to be set only if SPNEGO is to be used in authentication. SPNego authentication would be honored only if valid hive.server2.authentication.spnego.principal and hive.server2.authentication.spnego.keytab are specified.

property.name: hive.server2.authentication
property.description: Authentication mode, default NONE. Options are NONE, NOSASL, KERBEROS, LDAP, PAM and CUSTOM

property.name: hive.server2.authentication.spnego.principal
property.description: SPNego service principal, optional, typical value would look like HTTP/_HOST@EXAMPLE.COM SPNego service principal would be used by HiveServer2 when Kerberos security is enabled and HTTP transport mode is used. This needs to be set only if SPNEGO is to be used in authentication.

property.name: hive.metastore.event.db.notification.api.auth
property.description: Should metastore do authorization against database notification related APIs such as get_next_notification. If set to true, then only the superusers in proxy settings have the permission.

property.name: hive.server2.enable.doAs
property.description: Setting this property to true will have HiveServer2 execute Hive operations as the user making the calls to it.
property.display-name: Run as end user instead of Hive user

property.name: hive.server2.table.type.mapping
property.description: Expects one of [classic, hive]. This setting reflects how HiveServer2 will report the table types for JDBC and other client implementations that retrieve the available tables and supported table types HIVE : Exposes Hive's native table types like MANAGED_TABLE, EXTERNAL_TABLE, VIRTUAL_VIEW CLASSIC : More generic types like TABLE and VIEW

property.name: hive.server2.use.SSL
property.description: Set this to true for using SSL encryption in HiveServer2.

property.name: hive.user.install.directory
property.description: If hive (in tez mode only) cannot find a usable hive jar in "hive.jar.directory", it will upload the hive jar to "hive.user.install.directory/user.name" and use it to run queries.

property.name: hive.vectorized.groupby.maxentries
property.description: Max number of entries in the vector group by aggregation hashtables. Exceeding this will trigger a flush irrelevant of memory pressure condition.

property.name: hive.merge.nway.joins
property.description: Merge adjacent joins into a single n-way join

property.name: hive.prewarm.enabled
property.description: Enables container prewarm for Tez (Hadoop 2 only)

property.name: hive.prewarm.numcontainers
property.description: Controls the number of containers to prewarm for Tez (Hadoop 2 only)

property.name: hive.convert.join.bucket.mapjoin.tez
property.description: Whether joins can be automatically converted to bucket map joins in hive when tez is used as the execution engine.

property.name: hive.tez.auto.reducer.parallelism
property.description: Turn on Tez' auto reducer parallelism feature. When enabled, Hive will still estimate data sizes and set parallelism estimates. Tez will sample source vertices' output sizes and adjust the estimates at runtime as necessary.

property.name: hive.tez.max.partition.factor
property.description: When auto reducer parallelism is enabled this factor will be used to over-partition data in shuffle edges.

property.name: hive.tez.min.partition.factor
property.description: When auto reducer parallelism is enabled this factor will be used to put a lower limit to the number of reducers that tez specifies.

property.name: hive.tez.dynamic.partition.pruning
property.description: When dynamic pruning is enabled, joins on partition keys will be processed by sending events from the processing vertices to the tez application master. These events will be used to prune unnecessary partitions.

property.name: hive.tez.dynamic.partition.pruning.max.event.size
property.description: Maximum size of events sent by processors in dynamic pruning. If this size is crossed no pruning will take place.

property.name: hive.tez.dynamic.partition.pruning.max.data.size
property.description: Maximum total data size of events in dynamic pruning.

property.name: hive.tez.smb.number.waves
property.description: The number of waves in which to run the SMB join. Account for cluster being occupied. Ideally should be 1 wave.

property.name: hive.heapsize
property.description: Hive Java heap size

property.name: ambari.hive.db.schema.name
property.description: Database name used as the Hive Metastore

property.name: hive.vectorized.execution.enabled
property.description: This flag should be set to true to enable vectorized mode of query execution. The default value is false.

property.name: hive.auto.convert.join.noconditionaltask.size
property.description: If hive.auto.convert.join.noconditionaltask is off, this parameter does not take affect. However, if it is on, and the sum of size for n-1 of the tables/partitions for a n-way join is smaller than this size, the join is directly converted to a mapjoin(there is no conditional task).
property.display-name: For Map Join, per Map memory threshold

property.name: hive.optimize.index.filter
property.description: Whether to enable automatic use of indexes

property.name: hive.vectorized.groupby.checkinterval
property.description: Number of entries added to the group by aggregation hash before a recomputation of average entry size is performed.

property.name: hive.vectorized.groupby.flush.percent
property.description: Percent of entries in the group by aggregation hash flushed when the memory threshold is exceeded.

property.name: hive.compute.query.using.stats
property.description: When set to true Hive will answer a few queries like count(1) purely using stats stored in metastore. For basic stats collection turn on the config hive.stats.autogather to true. For more advanced stats collection need to run analyze table queries.
property.display-name: Compute simple queries using stats only

property.name: hive.limit.pushdown.memory.usage
property.description: The max memory to be used for hash in RS operator for top K selection.

property.name: hive.server2.tez.sessions.per.default.queue
property.description: A positive integer that determines the number of Tez sessions that should be launched on each of the queues specified by "hive.server2.tez.default.queues". Determines the parallelism on each queue.

property.name: hive.driver.parallel.compilation
property.description: This flag allows HiveServer2 to compile queries in parallel.

property.name: hive.server2.tez.initialize.default.sessions
property.description: This flag is used in HiveServer2 to enable a user to use HiveServer2 without turning on Tez for HiveServer2. The user could potentially want to run queries over Tez without the pool of sessions.

property.name: hive.server2.tez.default.queues
property.description: A list of comma separated values corresponding to YARN queues of the same name. When HiveServer2 is launched in Tez mode, this configuration needs to be set for multiple Tez sessions to run in parallel on the cluster.

property.name: hive.server2.webui.port
property.description: Web UI port address

property.name: hive.server2.webui.use.ssl
property.description: Enable SSL for HiveServer2 Interactive

property.name: hive.server2.webui.enable.cors
property.description: Enable cross origin requests (CORS)

property.name: hive.server2.webui.cors.allowed.headers
property.description: Comma separated list of http headers that are allowed when CORS is enabled.

property.name: hive.exec.orc.split.strategy
property.description: This is not a user level config. BI strategy is used when the requirement is to spend less time in split generation as opposed to query execution (split generation does not read or cache file footers). ETL strategy is used when spending little more time in split generation is acceptable (split generation reads and caches file footers). HYBRID chooses between the above strategies based on heuristics.

property.name: hive.vectorized.execution.reduce.enabled
property.description: This flag should be set to true to enable vectorized mode of the reduce-side of query execution.

property.name: hive.default.fileformat.managed
property.description: Default file format for CREATE TABLE statement applied to managed tables only. External tables will be created with default file format. Leaving this null will result in using the default file format for all tables.

property.name: datanucleus.rdbms.datastoreAdapterClassName
property.description: Datanucleus Class, This property used only when hive db is SQL Anywhere

property.name: atlas.hook.hive.minThreads
property.description: Minimum number of threads maintained by Atlas hook.

property.name: atlas.hook.hive.maxThreads
property.description: Maximum number of threads used by Atlas hook.

property.name: hive.hook.proto.base-directory
property.description: Base directory for hive proto hook.

property.name: hive.execution.mode
property.description: Chooses whether query fragments will run in container or in llap

property.name: hive.tez.input.generate.consistent.splits
property.description: Whether to generate consistent split locations when generating splits in the AM

property.name: hive.tez.exec.print.summary
property.description: Display breakdown of execution steps, for every query executed by the shell.

property.name: hive.vectorized.execution.mapjoin.native.enabled
property.description: This flag should be set to true to enable native (i.e. non-pass through) vectorization of queries using MapJoin.

property.name: hive.vectorized.execution.mapjoin.minmax.enabled
property.description: This flag should be set to true to enable vector map join hash tables to use max / max filtering for integer join queries using MapJoin.

property.name: hive.vectorized.execution.mapjoin.native.fast.hashtable.enabled
property.description: This flag should be set to true to enable use of native fast vector map join hash tables in queries using MapJoin.

property.name: hive.optimize.dynamic.partition.hashjoin
property.description: Whether to enable dynamically partitioned hash join optimization. This setting is also dependent on enabling hive.auto.convert.join

property.name: hive.metastore.event.listeners
property.description: Listeners for metastore events

property.name: hive.mapjoin.hybridgrace.hashtable
property.description: Whether to use hybrid grace hash join as the join method for mapjoin. Applies to dynamically partitioned joins when running in LLAP, but not to regular broadcast(map) joins. hive.llap.enable.grace.join.in.llap is used for this.

property.name: hive.tez.cartesian-product.enabled
property.description: Use Tez cartesian product edge for Hive cartesian product

property.name: hive.tez.bucket.pruning
property.description: When pruning is enabled, filters on bucket columns will be processed by filtering the splits against a bitset of included buckets. This needs predicates produced by hive.optimize.ppd and hive.optimize.index.filters.

property.name: hive.service.metrics.codahale.reporter.classes
property.description: Comma separated list of reporter implementation classes for metric class

property.name: hive.metastore.dml.events
property.description: If true, the metastore will be asked to fire events for DML operations

property.name: hive.repl.cm.enabled
property.description: Turn on ChangeManager, so delete files will go to cmrootdir.

property.name: hive.metastore.transactional.event.listeners
property.description: A comma separated list of Java classes that implement the org.apache.hadoop.hive.metastore.MetaStoreEventListener interface. Both the metastore event and corresponding listener method will be invoked in the same JDO transaction.

property.name: hive.repl.cmrootdir
property.description: Root dir for ChangeManager, used for deleted files.

property.name: hive.repl.rootdir
property.description: HDFS root dir for all replication dumps.

property.name: hive.vectorized.adaptor.usage.mode
property.description: Specifies the extent to which the VectorUDFAdaptor will be used for UDFs that do not have a corresponding vectorized class. 0. none : disable any usage of VectorUDFAdaptor 1. chosen : use VectorUDFAdaptor for a small set of UDFs that were chosen for good performance 2. all : use VectorUDFAdaptor for all UDFs
